contentrichtext.text: '''Ernest Chuard''' (July 31, 1857 – November 9, 1942) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician and [[member of the Swiss Federal Council]] (1919–1928). [[File:Ernest Chuard.gif|thumb|Ernest Chuard]] He was elected to the [[Swiss Federal Council]] on December 11, 1919 and handed over office on December 31, 1928. He was affiliated to the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland|Free Democratic Party]]. During his office time he held the [[Department of Home Affairs (Switzerland)|Department of Home Affairs]] and he was [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] in 1924. == External links == *{{Swiss Federal Councillor|52}} *{{HDS|4292}} {{start box}} {{succession box | before = [[Camille Decoppet]] | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1919â€“1928 | after = [[Marcel Pilet-Golaz]]}} {{end box}} {{Swiss Presidents}} {{Authority control|VIAF=45213672}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Chuard, Ernest | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = July 31, 1857 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = November 9, 1942 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chuard, Ernest}} [[Category:1857 births]] [[Category:1942 deaths]] [[Category:People from Broye-Vully District]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] {{Switzerland-politician-stub}}
